availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James W. Wilkins (A South Carolian-born, Hopkins County, Kentucky merchant.)

body.p: A South Carolian-born, Kentucky merchant. Lived in Hopkins County in 1860. Married to Eliza W. Wilkins. Father of Samuel M. Wilkins, Edward Wilkins, and Eliza W. Wilkins. Owned four enslaved persons in 1860. Served as Hopkins County commissioner of the common schools in 1853, 1859, and 1862.

bibl.p: "Report of the Superintendent of Public Instruction of Kentucky, for the Year 1859," (Frankfort, Ky.: Jno. B. Major, State Printer, 1860), 182; "Report of the Superintendent of Public Instruction of Kentucky, for the Year 1854," (Frankfort, Ky.: Jno. B. Major, State Printer, 1855), 55; "Report of the Superintendent of Public Instruction of Kentucky, for the Year Ending December 31, 1861," (Frankfort, Ky.: Jno. B. Major, State Printer, 1862), 131; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 246; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 26; "James W. Wilkins," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=59860797&ref=acom), (accessed on March 20, 2017).
